title: Wrestling Bulking Chili
description: High-protein, high-calorie chili built for hard gainers. Flavor-forward and meal-prep ready to support consistent muscle gain.

ingredients.notes: Use entire can as sauce base
Adds sweetness and texture; use entire bag

instructions: Heat oil over medium heat in a large Dutch oven; sauté (cook quickly in a small amount of oil over medium heat) onion until translucent, 3–4 minutes. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add ground beef; brown deeply (cook until well browned with no pink), 6–8 minutes, breaking into small pieces.
Stir in spices, then add the entire can of crushed tomatoes, the drained beans, and the entire bag of corn; bring to a simmer (gentle bubbling).
Simmer 30–40 minutes, stirring occasionally, until chili thickens enough to coat the back of a spoon; season to taste.
Portion into containers for the week; reheat to 165°F before serving.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Delivers 30–40g protein per serving to support muscle repair and growth
Meal-prep format helps hard gainers hit daily calorie targets
Highly enjoyable flavors encourage larger portions
storage: Keeps 3–4 days refrigerated or 2–3 months frozen. Reheat to 165°F internal temperature.

title: High-Protein Power Breakfast Bowl
description: Chicken, eggs, and quinoa with vegetables for a savory, protein-loaded breakfast that supports daily muscle building.
instructions: Sauté (cook quickly in a small amount of oil over medium heat) pepper in oil 2–3 minutes; add spinach to wilt.
Scramble eggs in pan until just set and glossy; season.
Warm quinoa and chicken; assemble bowls with all components.
Adjust seasoning and serve hot.
wrestling_specific_benefits: 30g+ morning protein kickstarts muscle protein synthesis
Savory flavors increase appetite in low-hunger hard gainers
Balanced carbs support later training sessions
storage: Keeps 3–4 days refrigerated. Reheat to 165°F or enjoy cold.

title: Muscle-Building Smoothie
description: Calorie-dense but digestible smoothie designed for post-practice recovery and off-season gains.
instructions: Add all ingredients to a blender.
Blend until smooth and drink immediately.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Liquid calories help hard gainers increase intake without fullness
Protein supports muscle repair post-practice
Carbs replenish glycogen for next session
storage: Best consumed immediately; if prepared ahead, keep refrigerated and consume within 24 hours. Shake before drinking.

title: Cashew Chicken Stir-Fry
description: Asian-inspired stir-fry with ample chicken and cashews for protein and calories without heavy sauces.
instructions: Heat neutral oil over medium-high heat; sear (cook undisturbed in hot oil to brown) chicken until browned and cooked through (165°F), 5–7 minutes.
Add garlic, broccoli, soy, hoisin, and sesame oil; toss to coat and warm 2–3 minutes.
Stir in cashews; serve over rice.
wrestling_specific_benefits: 30g+ protein per serving supports muscle gain
Palatable flavors encourage consistent large portions
Simple technique fits busy training schedules

title: Spicy Chicken Couscous Meal Prep
description: Macro-balanced chicken thighs with fast-cooking couscous for affordable, flavorful mass-gain meals.
instructions: Season chicken with paprika, garlic, salt, pepper; sear and cook through.
Bring broth to a boil; add couscous, cover off heat 5 minutes, fluff.
Portion couscous and chicken; garnish with parsley.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Thighs add flavor to improve appetite without excessive fat
High protein and easy carbs support training volume
Batch prep ensures consistent calorie intake
storage: Keeps 3–4 days refrigerated or 1–2 months frozen. Reheat to 165°F.

title: Seared Tuna with Sweet Potato
description: Mediterranean-style high-protein plate with simple flavors that encourage larger portions.
instructions: Roast or microwave sweet potato until tender (pierces easily with a fork).
Heat oil over medium-high heat; sear tuna 1–2 minutes per side until golden at edges; season and finish with lemon.
Serve immediately with sweet potato.
wrestling_specific_benefits: High-quality protein supports lean mass
Easy-to-like flavors promote adequate intake
Simple prep keeps consistency high in off-season
storage: Best fresh; cooked tuna is safe 3–4 days refrigerated. Reheat to 145°F if reheating.

title: Creamy High-Protein Pasta
description: Comforting pasta with a protein-forward creamy sauce that avoids heavy fats to keep appetite up.
instructions: Cook pasta to al dente (tender with a slight bite) in salted boiling water; reserve 3/4–1 cup pasta water.
Sear chicken over medium-high heat until cooked through (165°F); remove.
Sauté (cook quickly in a small amount of oil over medium heat) garlic 30 seconds; whisk in yogurt, broth, and Parmesan; adjust thickness with pasta water until sauce coats the back of a spoon.
Toss pasta and chicken in sauce; season to taste.
wrestling_specific_benefits: 30g+ protein per serving with enjoyable, familiar flavors
Moderate fat keeps appetite intact for total daily intake
Carbs support training volume and recovery
storage: Keeps 3–5 days refrigerated or 1–2 months frozen. Reheat to 165°F.

title: One-Pot Lentil Dahl (Protein-Forward)
description: Plant-forward dahl with elevated protein and approachable flavors for wrestlers and families.
instructions: Sauté (cook quickly in a small amount of oil over medium heat) onion, garlic, and ginger in oil until fragrant, 2–3 minutes.
Stir in curry powder; add lentils, broth, and coconut milk; simmer (gentle bubbling) 20–25 minutes until lentils are tender.
Fold in spinach to wilt; season and serve over rice if desired.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Plant-based protein adds variety for mass gain without relying on heavy fats
Comforting texture promotes appetite and repeat portions
Batch-friendly for consistent intake
storage: Keeps 3–4 days refrigerated or 2–3 months frozen. Reheat to 165°F.

title: Buffalo Chicken Protein Salad
description: High-protein chopped salad with buffalo-seasoned chicken for craveable flavor and mass-building macros.
instructions: Whisk yogurt and hot sauce to make a light buffalo dressing (smooth and pourable).
Toss romaine, celery, and carrots with dressing until lightly coated.
Top with chopped chicken and optional blue cheese.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Protein-forward salad boosts intake without heaviness
Craveable flavor encourages larger portions
Easy to prep ahead for busy training weeks

title: Curried Chicken & Lentils
description: Protein-dense chicken and lentils in a mild curry sauce for budget-friendly, mass-building meals.

ingredients.notes: Use entire can as sauce base

instructions: Sear chicken in oil and remove.
Sauté onion and garlic; add curry powder and toast 30 seconds.
Add lentils, broth, tomato; simmer 20–25 minutes; return chicken to warm.
Adjust seasoning and serve over rice if desired.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Chicken + lentils provide complete and sustained protein
Budget-friendly without sacrificing quality fuel
Meal prep format supports consistent intake
storage: Keeps 3–4 days refrigerated or 2–3 months frozen. Reheat to 165°F.

title: Breakfast Power Skillet
description: Eggs, potatoes, and turkey for a savory, high-protein skillet that fits breakfast-for-dinner strategies.
instructions: Brown turkey and potatoes in oil until crisp-tender.
Add pepper; cook 2 minutes.
Pour in eggs; scramble to desired doneness; season.
wrestling_specific_benefits: 30g+ protein supports daily muscle building
Comfort-food profile encourages large portions
One-pan method reduces effort for busy families

title: Korean-Inspired Beef Protein Bowl
description: Savory-sweet ground beef bowls over rice with vegetables; craveable flavor to drive intake.
instructions: Brown beef; add garlic and ginger; stir in soy and sugar.
Fold in carrots to soften.
Serve over rice; garnish with sesame seeds.
wrestling_specific_benefits: High-protein, high-enjoyment bowl promotes consistent eating
Carb base supports training volume
Easy to batch for weeknight reliability

title: Greek Yogurt Chicken Pasta Salad
description: Protein-packed pasta salad using Greek yogurt dressing to boost protein without excessive fat.

ingredients.notes: Cooked and cooled; using full box prevents waste

instructions: Whisk yogurt, lemon, oil, salt, pepper.
Combine pasta, chicken, celery, parsley; toss with dressing.
Chill or serve immediately.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Cold, savory meal increases appetite in low-hunger periods
High protein supports mass gain without heavy fats
Perfect for lunchboxes during off-season training

title: Tuna Rice Bowl (Budget Muscle)
description: Ultra-budget high-protein bowl with canned tuna, rice, and simple seasonings for reliable muscle-building meals.
instructions: Combine tuna with soy and optional mayo.
Serve over warm rice; top with green onion.
wrestling_specific_benefits: High-protein, affordable option ensures consistency
Quick prep fits busy schedules
Carb base supports recovery and training

title: Eggs & Cottage Cheese Scramble
description: Protein-boosted scramble using cottage cheese for extra protein and creamy texture without heavy fats.
instructions: Heat oil; add eggs; when halfway set, fold in cottage cheese.
Cook to soft curds; season and serve.
wrestling_specific_benefits: 30g+ protein at breakfast supports mass gain
Creamy texture improves palatability for low appetite
Fast prep increases compliance
